entry.def: Someone's descendants are the people in later generations who are related to them.

example.ex: They are descendants of the original English and Scottish settlers.
example.tran: 他们是最初的英格兰和苏格兰定居者的后代。

entry.tran: 派生物;衍生物;后代产物
entry.def: Something modern which developed from an older thing can be called a descendant of it.

example.ex: His design was a descendant of a 1956 device...
example.tran: 他的设计是从一个 1956 年的装置衍生而来的。

example.ex: They are the descendants of plants imported by the early settlers.
example.tran: 它们是早期移民带来的一些植物的后代。

means.word_mean: 1. all of the offspring of a given progenitor;

sentences.sentence: "we must secure the benefits of freedom for ourselves and our posterity"

Sentence.sentence: For decades,these descendants of the Viking shave been trying to show the world that the right mix of enlightened policy.

According to data gathered by Harvard Law School professor Lani Guinier, the most selective schools are more likely to choose blacks who have at least one immigrant parent from Africa or the Caribbean than black students who are descendants of American slaves.
